answers.answer: Yes, she will be okay from research I've done when I was around that many weeks. I'm 37 weeks now but she will be just fine.  Try to just take it easy though.

Oh ok yea I just love her so much already I'm scare to lose her and I just keep being told by everybody around me I look like I'm about to pop and my bf says my belly looks like it  dropped and he knows me very well so I believe him and I'm just so exhausted I just feel like I'm getting there

Normally baby is fully developed on the 36th week. Her lungs are still developing and if the doctor feels that she is gonna be early anytime before 36 weeks he might fasten her development of her lungs with medicines so that she can be fit to breath when she is here. They say lungs are the final organ to develop and mostly they rapidly develop when the baby is on its 34th week.
Oh ok thank you for the info I didn't know that I'm also scare she'll be here before time bc of my high blood pressure and gestational diabetes

You should try to eat healthy food to control both esp gestational diabetes. But high blood pressure is something that requires close monitoring.  Talk to your doctor and if he thinks it's better to get your baby out analyzing the severity of your condition he might give you a steroid shot to fasten her lungs' development and will try to induce labour or arrange for an emergency or scheduled c section. Since you know your situation always be in touch with your OB. I will not recommend you to goung to a midwife.

question: but I've been feeling like I will not make it to my due date I have no labor symptoms at all I just feel like I won't make it much more further I will be 31 weeks this week and my baby measures two weeks ahead if I was to happen to have my baby any time now before 40 weeks will she survive ?
